Chicago Film Fest pick of the day: 'An Evening with Howard Shore' Hugo 
A scene from "Hugo," which will be shown Sunday as part of the Chicago International Film Festival line-up. After the movie, composer Howard Shore will speak. 
A scene from "Hugo," which will be shown Sunday as part of the Chicago International Film Festival line-up. After the movie, composer Howard Shore will speak. Michael Phillips Contact Reporter Chicago Tribune Chicago film fest: See "Lord of the Rings" composer Howard Shore 
The "Lord of the Rings" composer is well known for many other sonic achievements, among them the swirling Parisian music for director Martin Scorsese's "Hugo," which is receiving a revival screening 2:30 p.m. Sunday as part of CIFFâ€™s 51 st line-up. Stick around afterward: Shore, an intergral component of every David Cronenberg project, among other credits, will appear in person for a discussion. 
5:30 p.m. Sunday, AMC River East 21, 322 E. Illinois St. Tickets $11-$14 at chicagofilmfestival.com . 
-Michael Phillips
